intro: Casearia euphlebia, commonly known as the red-leaf casearia, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are often reddish in color, especially when young. It produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by small, orange-red berries. Casearia euphlebia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal flowering.
